Reviews.Content: We just spent the night here - great hotel, large clean king room - large bathroom, great view from our window of the planes! Amazingly quiet being so close to the airport! Staff was very friendly. Loved the huge 'pond' on the grounds! Would definitely stay here again! Only downside was our room AC wasn't working properly -thermostat seemed broken, no matter what temp we set to, it was like the artic in the room, so we finally just turned it off!

Reviews.Title: “Insensitive to Customer's Concerns”
Reviews.Author: pooky_9
Reviews.Content: Worst service ever!! Don't stay in the over priced hotel with the worst service I have ever encountered. They were responsible for the damage of some of my clothing items, no one even offered to replace, send me a card, nothing. I had to buy new.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Parking”
Reviews.Author: kewldog4
Reviews.Content: I was immediately drawn to this hotel by the 10-day (I think) parking for airport travelers (especially with the gated parking lot!). We stayed there the night before the flight. Got up at 4:30 AM to hit the airport for an early morning flight. The service at this hotel is unmatched. However. the rooms were somewhat noisy. You could hear neighboring room and outside noise in the courtyard. However, we didn't mind because we just wanted to get to the airport as stress-free as possible and this hotel provided that. I probably would not stay there again UNLESS I had another early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little extras”
Reviews.Author: Ijit1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night here, but it was certainly a pleasant stay. I loved the little extras that I normally don't get other places; the nightly pretzel, chocolates on the pillow, and the Philadelphia Mike's soda. The only reason I didn't get this hotel the full five stars is the room I was in was a bit dated (old CRT television and well-worn desk). No big deal because it was all clean. Overall, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to starting a business trip. I'd stayed at another Renaissance property in Dallas in May so I pretty much knew what to expect &, for the most part, the property didn't disappoint. Beds are wonderfully comfy. I actually had a mini-fridge in my room, though it would have helped if someone had actually plugged it in. Bathroom was quite large & nicely decorated. Cable tv line-up was more extensive than one usually finds in a hotel. The hotel restaurant, which IS open every night for dinner (despite claims to the contrary by the front desk staff) was very nice, especially the tilapia which is part of their new 'T.A.R.P.S' menu-most definately recommend it!! The downside is that this hotel is literally out in the middle of nowhere. When my friend came to pick me up the next day, the front desk gave her a total of 4 different street address' for her to use in her GPS to pick me up, but the GPS system couldn't find any of them. Also, be warned, this hotel is the layover spot for at least 2 different airlines & the flight crews tend to take over the airport shuttles w/little regard to the rest of the passengers on-board (I had the misfortune of having to ride w/a crew from both Delta & Southwest & it wasn't pleasant).

Reviews.Title: “Beware-no hot water-poor A/C-aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I had clients booked at this hotel. Upon arrival last night, the clerk had no reservation. They called me and I referenced the confirmation numbers to the call center. The call center indicated the HOTEL cancelled the reservations on April 29. No reason for the cancellation was stated. One client complained of poor A/C in his room and they both had no hot water this morning. The hotel did give them 10,000 bonus points for the inconvenience. I have conducted several events in this hotel in the years past and never had problems. I must agree with other reviews that the hotel is aging.

Reviews.Title: “had a problem but it was handled well”
Reviews.Author: TheSidingGuy
Reviews.Content: There were issues with the food but they took care of. We had a convention there. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mistysthe1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked it to hotel for Valentines weekend, We were very dissapointed at what we walked into. There were 2 teenage girls basketball team and 3 boys hockey teams staying the weekend aswell. There were kids running ramped all night through halls,screaming slambing doors, security had thier hands full chasing them all weekend! Had no piece and quiet all weekend. I have 2 teenage girls myself who would never act like that ever! They were pouring shampoo in the whirlpool and it was a bubbly mess. Indoor pool was a mess and was screaming all night till 10 pm. Did not sleep at all the whole weekend! Was very dissapointing!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but nice”
Reviews.Author: bahoss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little hard to find, we drove right by the road you needed to turn onto. The hotel is older and has been refurbished many times. The room was nicely decorated and we got a small bottle of sparkling wine at check in. We did have a problem with our toilet clogging and since it was 11:00PM there was no one there for maintenance so we had to change rooms. The next morning our shower had a VERY slow drain. The manager apologized and said they are in the process of working on bathrooms since the hotel is old.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: starrynites0514
Reviews.Content: To keep this short and sweet. My husband and I stayed here from one night to fly out in the morning. We were pleasantly surprised when arriving. Staff was nice and check in was smooth. When we got to our room we were more than happy with the decor and especially the bed. It was VERY comfortable. The pool area is nice however we didnt use it. The bar was also cute. We had a drink to start off our vacation. I will say, it was hard to wake up in the morning due to the comfort of the bed. BUT it had to be done! I would most certainly return here. The service is great and the shuttle service is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Service”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property because the conference I was speaking at was being held there, so it was not as if I had chosen it. Based on it's location, the only other reason to stay here is if you are flying in/out of PHL. Based on the service, however, I wish they were located wherever I travel frequently. The hotel is truly isolated in the middle of nowhere except near the airport. Upon arrival, the front desk staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful. Actually, they approached the level of "sickly sweet" without quite hitting that threshold. Kudos to them for outstanding service! When we wanted to take a cab to South Philly for dinner, they called a local cab company and were told that it would be a 20 minute wait. They suggested, instead, that we just hop on the airport shuttle that was leaving in a couple of minutes and just pick up a cab at the airport, thus also taking advantage of the airport flat fee into town. It was an excellent suggestion and we were in a cab within a few minutes. The rooms in this atrium style hotel were a decent size and nicely furnished - about what I would expect from a Renaissance. The concierge lounge was very well stocked and staffed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxin' at the Ren'”
Reviews.Author: jazzpants
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I needed to stay at the hotel for one night because we had an early flight the next morning. We took the train down to the airport. We phoned for a shuttle and they picked us up in a reasonable amount of time. Upon arrival, we were greeted by some terrific people at the front desk. While checking in the gentleman asked what the occasion was. When I told him we were on our honeymoon, he upgraded our room. He was even kind enough to grant us access to the conseirge room. I was extremely pleased by all of this. They did give us a Polish water ice as well as soft pretzels in the room. The upgraded room did have a seperate room with a large table and chairs for perhaps a meeting, and the bedroom was large and included a small couch. Once settled, we took a small walk around the property and ventured into the bar. While the bar is nothing that special, it was clean had a flat screen tv. Most people in there were ordering burgers and other bar food as well as drinks. The fine dining restaurant was next door but we did not want to spend the money nor did we want to get dressed up for it. We did head up to the Conseirge room. Once you enter, you sign in. There is some tables, chairs, as well as a couch. There is a small staff keeping the fridge stocked with free soft drinks, water, snacks, and some small buffet items. By no means was this an all you can eat bar, but it did the trick. They had some warm finger foods and desserts. There was a wonderful woman who was in charge of the room and kept things running smoothly. She was very personable and plesant. She was very familiar with the "regulars" as she knew their names etc. I imagine that would make a traveller feel more at home. She promptly introduced her to us. What a great person. While there, you can drink wine and beer but it is billed to your room. No biggie. There is a TV to zone out to or you can look out the window and watch the planes lift off from PHL. We eventually returned to the room for the night. The bed was set up well and was comfortable. It was not the most comfortalble bed I was ever in but it was good. We left at 5am and checked out. Check out was smooth. We then took a shuttle to the airport. I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN! People do make the difference and the Renaissance is doing a great job managing that and making it happen.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper alternative to downtown Philly lodging--FREE parking”
Reviews.Author: luvtakintrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to go to a Phillies game and visit downtown Philly. We found this hotel to be more than $150 cheaper than downtown lodgings. The parking here is free, unlike the downtown hotels. The hotel is located south of the airport and is tricky to find. But we found the hotel to be clean, with a spacious comfortable 2-bed room. And it's a 10 minute drive to the ballpark and a 15 minute drive to downtown. For being considered an airport hotel, we didn't hear a sound. The hotel is nestled in a wetlands preservation area. Pros - Free parking, much cheaper rate than downtown hotels, only a 10-15 minute drive to ballparks/downtown Cons- Tricky to find at first, more remote location away from food/gas

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: VaTravel1
Reviews.Content: Booked the room well in advance, and got a great rate of $117 per night for 4 nights. Room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was some of the friendliest I've dealt with in a long time. From the front desk to the cab stand to the wait staff, everyone was extremely pleasant. Kids loved the pool. One drawback is that there are no restaurants within walking distance, so the airport shuttle or a cab are the only options. Fortunately, the hotel breakfast buffet ($14 per person) was open until 11am, so we used it as a combined breakfast/lunch. Be sure to have Otis make you an omelette or fresh waffles with real whipped cream. The food was so plentiful that we didn't need to eat again until dinner. Would recommend this hotel if you don't mind being a bit out of the way from center city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient option”
Reviews.Author: travels-from-MD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long flight back from an overseas vacation. On the plus side: Extremely helpful and pleasant staff - some of the best I have encountered anywhere. Comfortable beds. Park/fly option is convenient. Great burgers in the lounge. Good breakfast in the concierge. Things that could be improved: Overall cleanliness of rooms, carpets, pool area, etc. (There was refurbishing work underway during our stay which should help.) Note if using the airport shuttle: When flying out, we found a regular shuttle service departing from the hotel - very efficient with clear departure times. I would suggest calling the hotel to specifically request a pick up from the airport terminal as soon as you return so that you don't wind up waiting nearly an hour (as we did) for the shuttle to take you back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Renaissance hotel property!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyC123
Reviews.Content: I have just returned (June 9-11, 2008) from a two nite stay at this property and I vow not to return. I am a very frequent Marriott business traveller and I stay in Marriott properties almost exclusively. Apparently, the hotel air conditioning system is in need of upgrades. My room was so hot for 2 nites that I slept very poorly. The staff said that "there was nothing" that they could do. I ordered room service and my meal was lukewarm and my chicken looked like death warmed over. I used the concierge lounge for 2 mornings. The room was so hot you could barely stand it. The staff had provided a large stand up style fan which helped but not much. The coffee maker in the lounge was "out of service" and the coffee pot provided was empty. The desk clerk made me wait at check in while he checked in airline personnel that arrived after me ( I am a Marriott platinum member). This hotel is not worth it at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: dillybarPa
Reviews.Content: Check-in was the best ever! Khalil Rembert greated us with a smile and gave us water ice to enjoy while he was waiting for housekeeping to finish getting our room ready. We even received an upgrade! Although the room was a bit worn the rooms by us were being updated. Khalil made our stay the best! Thanks Khalil!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, good service.”
Reviews.Author: ArthurMF
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this hotel based upon the recent reviews. It was quite nice. The room (9th floor) was in excellent shape, quiet and very clean. Upon check-in, received a Hanks Gourmet root beear and hot cookie. And the concierge level. Went there, but they were closing and cleaning. Nice woman let me have anything I wanted from the snacks and non-alcohol (rest was locked away already). Breakfast the following morning was in concierge and acceptable. Cereals, cheese, fruit, toast. Hard boiled eggs. I swam in the pool and then sat in the hot tub before I needed to leave. $223 for the night. Which for Philly airport was reasonable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in Philly hotels”
Reviews.Author: sig225
Reviews.Content: Been to Philadelphia a lot over the past two years and stayed in a variety of hotels... uniformly they have been over-priced and the hospitality and cleanliness have been substandard. The Renaissance has been a pleasant surprise... for the first time I wasn't greeted by surly staff.. they were so helpful, pleasant, polite and welcoming! While there is a small problem with the speed at which they clear dining materials from the hallways and the thoroughness with which they clean the rooms (I am particular) the hotel itself was great and they were quick to respond to needs. Oh... if you want to sleep past 8am do not accept a room overlooking the pool. Children tend to get up early and play "Marco Polo" in the pool and you'll be wakened as soon as the pool opens. Otherwise, having a poolside room gives you a nice balcony and a beautiful view of the wildlife preserve.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: knight_w_o_armor
Reviews.Content: Stayed over two nights (4/18-4/20/08). Tried and got it on Priceline for $70/nt, after being unable to get a 4* hotel on PL in downtown Philly for less than twice that amount. (www.biddingfortravel.com has great tips and info for this). Upon asking, the front desk was very willing to upgrade us to Concierge level- but since the Concierge Club Lounge is not open on weekends (this hotel is hardly busy on the weekends apparently), they also gave us complimentary passes for a continential breakfast buffet (could upgrade to the full hot buffet for $3). Buffet was okay, not great but did have an omelette station. The room was recently renovated, but still had a slight air fresher scent (a concern I had given other recent reviews). Very nice bedding. Quiet room. Large bathroom with good shower and good toiletries (come on, you know you're gonna take 'em home). Room renovation was ongoing, so just make sure your room is one of the renovated ones and not close to any ongoing work. The pool area is very nice, decent exercise room and the staff was very accommodating. Parking is free- which is a significant deal. You can take the hotel's free shuttle to the airport and pick up the SEPTA train into downtown Philly for $6 (trip takes a half hour). Would stay here again if unable to get a good deal at a 4* in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Motomom243
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night for the "park and fly" option and were excited to try a new hotel. Usually we stay at the Sheraton Suites and enjoy it there. We should not have changed. The positive is that our service there was really great. With that said, the room was very smelly, like mold and urine. Since we were only there for a quick nights sleep we didn't complain. The other complaint is that when we flew back in we waited for over an hour for the hotel shuttle, saw all the the other hotel shuttles multiple times, and then finally called the hotel, They said that we were supposed to call for pick up but that is not what we were told. We were told that the shuttel runs every 20 minutes so we were trying to be patient. They then told us it would be 10 minuted to get us and about 20 minutes later, they finally came (they are only 1 mile from the airport) and the driver said that you need to call them unless it is a busy time of day for travelers. Oaky, well we don't know when that is so get the story straight. I try to stay at Marriott brands whenever possible since I am a silver member but will not be coming back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: vero_isa
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The person at the front desk greeted us when we arrived and was very courteous and professional during the check-in process. They gave us 2 ice tea bottles and fresh pretzel as a welcoming snack. That was awesome!! Once at the room, it was totally clean and nicely decorated. There was a personalized letter in the desk welcoming us to the hotel. Also with the letter was a card with the weather forecast for the entire weekend. Iâ€™ve never received such attention when arriving to a hotel before!! Not even at the Ritz. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was also spacious and very clean. The bed was amazing. The linen was at least 400 threads and cotton, which make it a better night sleep for tired tourists. No noise from the highway at all. Very quiet ful for a light sleeper like me. The staff at the front desk was always courteous and helpful. One night we asked for directions to nearby movies and the person was extremely helpful with locations and other suggestions in the area. The location of the hotel is convenient for anyone needing a hotel near the airport or visiting the Philly area. The hotel is well located with easy access to I-95. It took us less than 15 minutes to drive to and from Philly downtown from the hotel. Overall, this Renaissance is much better to other hotels including its partners, Marriotts. Iâ€™m totally impressed and I would definitely stay at this hotel again when returning to the Philly area.

Reviews.Title: “A good ending to a not so good day.”
Reviews.Author: jblairgolf
Reviews.Content: After missing our flight in Philadelphia I tried frantically tcalled my wife and asked her to try and get us an airport hotel at PHL. She quickly got on PL and bid $95 for a 3* hotel, hoping I would get the airport Marriott (since their lowest rate was $269). Much to my dismay (only initially) they 'upgraded' me to a 4* which was the Renaissance, but I didn't want a 4*, I wanted a 3* due to their location. So much for thetheory of bidding higher to have a better chance at the3* hotel I wanted. Initially I was not happy because the hotel is clearly father away from the airport than the other 3*'s listed. To make a long story short, wechecked in and spoke with Patrick, a lovely man from Haiti that speaks 5 languages...quite impressive. He took very good care of us, and offered us an upgrade to the Concierge level. What a nice surprise, especially after the stress of missing our flight, changing our car rental, dealing with cancelling and changing guaranteed hotel rooms, etc. We are very discriminating travelers, and I was nervous (based on a few negative reviews) about how they we would react once at the hotel. Our service on the Concierge level was very good, check in easy and professional, rooms very clean and comfortable, and overall a very good ending to a not so good day. I would not hesitate one minute about staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST airport hotels ANYWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: elmarko
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one day stay at the Renaissance Philadelphia Airport. What can I say? This hotel was a total surprise. Great staff and attitudes at check-in, wonderfully, spacious, well-appointed room, large, immaculate bathroom, great shower, comfortable bed with choice of pillows, great workspace. I totally surprised! The staff in both the lounge (which serves full-course dinners as well) and cafe were superior. All were extraordinarily friendly and provided great service at very reasonable prices. Their workout room was perfect and not crowded. If you've got to stay over at Philadelphia Airport, this is the only place to stay. It's easily a 4 **** facility which is reflected in the attitude and service of the staff. This is a fine hotel in most every other city, but at this particular airport, I consider it a total find!

Reviews.Title: “Your opinion is going to depend on how much you pay...”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline.com for $72 a night. I feel I got a pretty good deal. This hotel is not dirty. It is not unsafe. It is however in need of a renovation, and does not carry same quality that most upper level Marriott hotels carry. Bottom line: if you get a good deal on this place, you'll be pleased. If you pay full price, I guarantee you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Philadelphia Airport”
Reviews.Author: Lifeontheroad
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Renaissance Philadelphia Airport Hotel in early August 2007 on business. What a great stay! The room I had was on the 8th floor, and it had an exceptional view. The room itself was smartly appointed and decorated, spotless, and very warm and inviting. I also had the opportunity to have two meals in their onsite restaurant, which was very good. All interactions with the hotel staff was positive. The location is extremely convenient to the airport. I would recommend this property to anyone wanting/needing to stay in the Philadelphia airport vacinity, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel but a horrible location....”
Reviews.Author: bceagle90
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for a business conference. Technically speaking it is close to Philadelphia International Airport but what they don't tell you is that it is located right next to one of the active runways. This basically means you will hear jets take off and land all day and all night. While they do offer a complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport you still have to go literally a couple of miles out of the way to get to the place. The hotel sits right in the middle of a swamp, or as they like to refer to a "wildlife preserve". If you don't have a car you are screwed as there is NOTHING within walking distance of the hotel. Unless you order pizza delivery your only dining options are the two in-house restaurants, one is actually more of a bar than a restaurant. If you want to travel to downtown Philly a cab is approximately $40 each way. Room was fine and staff was generally very friendly and helpful but this is definitely not the best place to go if you want a hotel with things to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at a good priice”
Reviews.Author: BigBruno
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline for $65 for a Friday night. Front desk staff was very friendly and they gave me a very nice room. Bed, sheets, and pillows were soft and wonderful. Room is older style but still elegant. I parked my car at the hotel and took the shuttle to and from the airport. Parking is $50 for a week. Nice way to go it you have an early flight out of Philly. If I could get that kind of price again, I'd stay there in a heartbeat. If your a smoker, this is a non-smoking hotel. You can't even smoke in the bar so be prepared to go outside. I wasn't there long but the hotel certainly served its purpose at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Week-end Value, But Beginning to Need Freshening”
Reviews.Author: tylerarb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night (August 4) because of a family emergency. Got the senior rate of $110 which is a decent but not outstanding value. We had stayed at this property on 5 or 6 previous occasions, always on week-ends and have generally been satisfied with it. The room--on the 9th floor-was clean, fresh-smelling and what we wanted. There was a view of the air conditioning equipment on a lower, flat room, but we weren't there for the view and only used the hotel to sleep. Check-in was smooth, quick and courteous. We arrived shortly after noon and the front desk made a special effort to have a room serviced so that we wouldn't have to return late at night and check-in again. All of the staff we met were friendly and helpful. Parking was OK and free (my favorite price) but although the lot is large, it always seems to be fairly full and finding a space requires a careful search. Both the room and some of the public areas of the hotel are beginning to show wear. It isn't a serious issue for the most part, but does require attention. One family member spent Aug 3 and 4 at this property and always has liked it. She also mentioned that her room was not up to the standard of previous stays. Our room had what looked like a spilled red wine stain on the bathroom wallpaper. [It was between the toilet and the tub, low on the wall and not immediately noticeable.] The foot stool fabric was completely torn or worn through on one corner, showing the padding. The entry to the hotel needs a good power washing, sealing and regrouting in some areas. A careful inspection of the hotel likely will turn up dozens if not hundreds of places that need maintenance attention soon. This property still is above average for the Philadelphia Airport Hotel properties we have used: Sheraton Suites, Embassy Suites, and Residence Inn, though some of those mentioned obviously offer more space and comparisons aren't completely fair. We would stay there again and, despite the comments above, were happy with the place and the rate. If I stayed during the week and paid twice as much, I would be far less satsified. The Renaissance is not easy to find for first-time guests using rental cars and not immediately convenient to much of anything else, other than the airport. It is, however, only about a 10-15 minute drive or cab ride from Center City Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NeuroAngiodoc
Reviews.Content: No complaints, was treated extremely well at every step. A lot of freebies in the room, and was upgraded to Conscierre Floor which was awesome. Food in bar/restaurant was excellent and I highly recommend if you need a 1-2 nighter near the airport. BTW about 5 minutes from Harrah's Casino, the closest hotel to the casino and racetrack!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: maureenfh
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on reviews here, and I was not disappointed. Our room was neat and clean, the price was comparable to others in the area, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was great. We had a great time. Upon checking in, I asked about coupons for breakfast, and the person at the desk gave me a pass for 2 free breakfast buffets. Definitely make sure you do this, because the breakfast is fine, but not really worth the $12 per person they charge. They also seem to have a regular menu to choose from, but we just had the buffet. After our room was cleaned the first night, we found ourselves with only one clean bath towel. I called down for more towels and they arrived very quickly (within 10 minutes) and the desk staff person called a few minutes later to make sure we had gotten them. We were in town for a wedding west of Philly, and this was close to the interstate, so very convenient for getting to where we wanted to go. We also went into downtown Philly for the afternoon and it took only 20 minutes. My only complaint was the difficulty we had finding the hotel. Another reviewer here mentioned this, and I should have taken it more seriously! The directions on the website are USELESS, so don't take them. Even the Google maps directions were vague unless you are familiar with the area, so maybe call the hotel and get someone to give you specific directions? Once you actually get there, there is no sign at the entrance to tell you where to turn, so we found ourselves elated at finally finding it, only to despair as we drove past it again, realizing we would have to go back to the main road to turn around and start again. A little frustrating after a long flight. One more tiny complaint: my husband had to run back to the airport for a lost item and took the hotel shuttle, which was fine, but he waited a long time for it to come pick him up later. If you are relying on the shuttle, be sure to call and tell them when you'll be arriving, and give them plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: KitinIowa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the airport in Philly. I used it for one night before an early flight out the next morning. They upgraded me to the club floor upon asking without additional cost since I was a Silver Rewards member I assume. The club attendant was very nice and interested in you. The pool is adequate, but the whirlpool had cool water in it, they did come in and adjust the water temp while I was using it and I think it was warming up but didn't stay in long enough to find out how warm. The hotel needs attention and a remodel, but otherwise I found it to be a nice place to stay. Over the long term I would choose somewhere else, but for a night it was fine.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Philadelphia Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Stevens Drive, Philadelphia, PA 19113
